en.users_help:
With this bot you can contact the admin/s of this bot.
You can also change the bot language.

The bot is an open source project, if you want to add additional languages to the bot or offer it improvements or create one for yourself as well, you can [contact the creator of the bot](https://t.me/ido1234) or alternatively send suggestions on the [bot's page in GitHub](https://github.com/idokar/TGanonymusChatBot)
en.admins_help:
With this bot, users can contact you and more admins of this bot (see the 'Admins' button below), you can also limit the bot for a specific group, block users from using the bot, set a welcome message and change the bot language.

The bot is an open source project, if you want to add additional languages to the bot or offer it improvements or create one for yourself as well, you can [contact the creator of the bot](https://t.me/ido1234) or alternatively send suggestions on the [bot's page in GitHub](https://github.com/idokar/TGanonymusChatBot)
en.help_block:
With the command `/block` you can restrict users from using this bot.
If you want to block a user from using the bot, you have to reply the user message (or the message that follow the user message that says "reply to this message") with the command `/block`.

If you want to release a blocked user you have to reply the user message (or the message that follow the user message that says "reply to this message") with the command `/unblock'.

In case you want to see all the blocked user you can use the command `/settings` and then press on 'Blocked list'.
en.help_admins:
**Only the creator of the bot** can promote or demote admins on this bot.
Admins on this bot can: contact with the users, can change set or remove the welcome message, can set a group of users (see 'Group settings' below) and block or unblock users from using the bot.

If you want to promote user to be an admin you have to reply the user message (or the message that follow the user message that says "reply to this message") with the command `/promote` **or** send the command `/promote` withe the user ID (without replying a message) e.g: `/promote 123456789`.

If you want to demote admin you can do the same but instead of using the command `/promote` **use the command** `/demote`,
e.g: `/demote 123456789`. or in a reply to a message.

In case you want to see a list of the admins you can use the command `/settings` and then press on 'Admins list'.
en.help_welcome:
If you wish, you can make the bot to send a custom welcome message to the users when a user send `/start` to the bot.
If you want to create a welcome message you can use the command `/set welcome` followed by the message itself, e.g. ```/set welcome hello $name welcome to my bot```

if you wish you can also format your message with parameters or text formatting.
parameters:
    $id - the user telegram ID.
    $first_name - the first name of the user.
    $last_name - the last name of the user (not always exist)
    $username - the telegram username of the user (not always exist)
    $user - a link to the user with the user name.
    $name - the full name of the user (first + last)

For **bold text** use `*` (from both sides of the text), for __italic__ use `_` (from both sides of the text), for ~~strikethrough~~ use `~` (from both sides of the text), for --underline-- use `-` (from both sides of the text) and for [text link](http://example.com) you can use ```[Text](url link)```.

If you want to use one of this characters without formatting the text, you can escape them with `\` (e.g. '\_' or '\-'...).

To remove the welcome message send `/settings` and then press on âœ…
**Attention: this operation is not reversible and once performed it won't be possible to restore  the welcome message, so if you want to return the previous welcome message, you should recreate it with `/set welcome`.
